p: The duration of symptoms of older children infected with A/H1N1pdm09 and A/H3N2 (aged >5 years; median range, 4–5 days) was shorter compared with younger children (aged <5 years; median range, 5–6 days; *.05 > P > .01 and **.01 > P > .001) ( Supplementary Figure 4). This age-related difference in symptom duration was less pronounced when infected children were stratified according to their antiviral treatment status ( Supplementary Figures 5 and 6). There was no significant observed difference in symptom resolution between the age groups of all children infected with influenza B virus ( Supplementary Figures 4− 6).
